extracted_information.project_description: This project addresses the challenge of limited publicly available COVID-19 CT datasets for AI-powered diagnosis. It utilizes an open-sourced dataset called COVID-CT, developed by UC San Diego and UC Berkeley, which contains 349 COVID-19 CT images (from 216 patients) and 463 non-COVID-19 CTs. The utility of this dataset has been confirmed by a senior radiologist. The dataset's materials, including processed images (CT_COVID.zip, CT_NonCOVID.zip) and meta-information (COVID-CT-MetaInfo.xlsx), were collected from COVID-19 related papers. The primary aim of this project is to perform binary image classification (specifically, 'COVID-vs-NonCOVID') using Transfer Learning techniques and to subsequently optimize the classification results.
key_features: Utilizes Transfer Learning for image classification.
Leverages an open-sourced COVID-CT dataset (from UC San Diego and UC Berkeley) for training.
